Description: Painted pottery Fikellura neck-amphora. Shoulder, tongues in compartments: open cable. Belly (on each side) a comast between handle volutes: crescents: blobs. Missing the neck, handles and half of the body.
Curator's comments: An additional fragment (1888,0208.51 re-registered as 1924,01201.1103, published in CVA British Museum 8, Pl. GB 576, 18), belongs to the same vessel. Cook (CVA, p. 12) dates this more narrowly than Weber to 550 BC - 540 BC. BSA xxxiv, 16 (J 8), 17; 16 (J 7), 17, 66, 74, 79.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 579, 4 (and GB 576, 18))
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 198 & TD 199)
Condition: Neck and half the body missing; repaired and restored in parts.
